title: GWPy version 0.10.0
citation: D. Macleod, A. L. Urban, S. Coughlin, T. J. Massinger, J. Areeda, E. Quintero, and The Gitter Badger. (2018). gwpy/gwpy: 0.10.0 (Version v0.10.0). Zenodo.

title: Reconstructing the calibrated strain signal in the Advanced LIGO detectors
excerpt: This paper documents the calibration scheme used to reconstruct strain data during Advanced LIGO.
citation: A. D. Viets, M. Wade, A. L. Urban, S. Kandhasamy, J. Betzwieser, Duncan A. Brown, J. Burguet-Castell, C. Cahillane, E. Goetz, K. Izumi, S. Karki, J. S. Kissel, G. Mendell, R. L. Savage, X. Siemens, D. Tuyenbayev, and A. J. Weinstein. (2018). "Reconstructing the calibrated strain signal in the Advanced LIGO detectors,” CQG 35 (9).

title: GW170817: Observation of Gravitational Waves from a Binary Neutron Star Inspiral
excerpt: This paper reports the first direct detection of a binary neutron star inspiral at 40 Mpc.
citation: B. P. Abbott et al. (2017). "GW170817: Observation of Gravitational Waves from a Binary Neutron Star Inspiral,” Phys. Rev. Lett. vol. 119, p. 161101.

title: Gravitational Waves and Gamma-rays from a Binary Neutron Star Merger: GW170817 and GRB 170817A
excerpt: This paper reports the first gamma-ray burst observed in coincidence with a gravitational wave signal.
citation: B. P. Abbott et al. (2017). "Gravitational Waves and Gamma-rays from a Binary Neutron Star Merger: GW170817 and GRB 170817A,” ApJ vol. 848, no. 2.

title: GW170814: A Three-Detector Observation of Gravitational Waves from a Binary Black Hole Coalescence
excerpt: This paper reports the first observation of a gravitational wave signal by the Virgo detector in Cascina, Italy.
citation: B. P. Abbott et al. (2017). “GW170814: A Three-Detector Observation of Gravitational Waves from a Binary Black Hole Coalescence,” Phys. Rev. Lett. vol. 119, p. 141101.

title: Observation of Gravitational Waves from a Binary Black Hole Merger
excerpt: The first direct detection of gravitational waves, from a stellar-mass binary black hole merger.
citation: B. P. Abbott et al. (2016). “Observation of Gravitational Waves from a Binary Black Hole Merger,” Phys. Rev. Lett. vol. 116, p. 061102.

title: Prospects for Observing and Localizing Gravitational-Wave Transients with Advanced LIGO, Advanced Virgo and KAGRA
excerpt: The observing scenarios envisioned for the era of advanced gravitational wave detectors.
citation: B. P. Abbott et al. (2016). “Prospects for Observing and Localizing Gravitational-Wave Transients with Advanced LIGO, Advanced Virgo and KAGRA,” Living Rev. Rel. 19 (1).
